underlying_goal: The user wanted to fix and merge two overlapping figures in a paper, ensuring they were accurate and visually clear with proper error bars.
friction_detail: The plotting script initially failed to display error bars because of a data parsing bug where the Standard Error of the Mean (SEM) values were being read as zero.
primary_success: Claude diagnosed and fixed a subtle data parsing bug in the plotting script that was causing error bars to be invisible, then engaged in a nuanced discussion about statistical methodology and winner determination.
brief_summary: The user requested to merge two overlapping figures and add error bars. Claude merged them, but then had to debug why the error bars were invisible, eventually finding and fixing a data parsing bug in the plotting script. This led to a productive discussion about the wide error bars and the correct statistical interpretation, resulting in an updated and more accurate figure.
